text.p: The following are leading domestic stories in Portuguese newspapers.
- Petrogal's share of oil production in Angola is worth one third of the energy consumed in Portugal and half the company's needs for refining.
- Ship repair company Lisnave, whose representatives met government officials on Wednesday, sees profit over second half of year.
- The Government intends to double money transferences and to increase responsibilities of municipalities in 1998.
- Brussels considered the Portuguese convergence programme to be positive, although it regrets the lack of reform to the health and social security systems and public administration.

- Unemployment will increase in the industrial and agricultural sector in the next years and Portugal should invest in segments with competitive advantage, the Minister of Employment, Maria Joao Rodrigues said.
